body_html:
I am having similar issues.

Versions:

$ pip --version
pip 9.0.3 from [...]local\programs\python\python35\lib\site-packages (python 3.5)
  • CUDA 9.1
  • tensorflow-gpu (1.7.0)

Content of folders:

  • C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\cudnn\bin
    • cudnn64_7.dll
  • C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.1\bin
    • cudart64_91.dll
    • and a bunch other dll

Error:

ImportError: Could not find 'cudart64_90.dll'. 
TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. 
Download and install CUDA 9.0 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit

As a test, I copied the 94_91 dll and renamed it to match what tensorflow is looking for but I get that:

[...]
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.

Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.

I tried with tf-nightly-gpu (1.8.0.dev20180329) but get the same error about cudart64_90.dll

Any idea what I should do ?

body:
I am having similar issues.

Versions:
```
$ pip --version
pip 9.0.3 from [...]local\programs\python\python35\lib\site-packages (python 3.5)
```
* `CUDA 9.1` 
* `tensorflow-gpu (1.7.0)`

Content of folders:
* `C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\cudnn\bin`
    * `cudnn64_7.dll`
* `C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.1\bin`
    * `cudart64_91.dll`
    * and a bunch other dll

Error:
```
ImportError: Could not find 'cudart64_90.dll'. 
TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. 
Download and install CUDA 9.0 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit
```

As a test, I copied the `94_91` dll and renamed it to match what `tensorflow` is looking for but I get that:
```
[...]
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.

Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.
```

I tried with `tf-nightly-gpu (1.8.0.dev20180329)` but get the same error about `cudart64_90.dll`

Any idea what I should do ?
